registration_process.title: How to Register for Hackfest
registration_process.description: Follow these steps to secure your team's spot for the Hackfest event.

steps.title: Assemble Your Squad
steps.description: First, form a team of 3 to 5 members. We only accept group registrations, so find your fellow developers, designers, and problem-solvers.
notes: Pro-Tip: Our selection process prioritizes teams with a balanced mix of skills (e.g., developer, designer, product/business). A diverse team has a higher chance of being selected!

steps.title: Review the Code of Conduct
steps.description: Before proceeding, ensure every team member has read and agreed to the DevFest Code of Conduct. A positive and respectful environment is mandatory for all participants.

steps.title: Complete the Online Registration Form
steps.description: Designate one person as the team captain to fill out the registration form. You will need to provide the following information:
required_info: An overview of your team's collective technical skills and roles.
A brief statement on why your team is interested in tackling the TMII challenges.
notes: As we expect high interest and have a limit of 30 teams, please be thorough. Your application will be a key part of our curation process if we receive more than 30 submissions.

steps.title: Pay the Commitment Fee
steps.description: To finalize your registration, a commitment fee is required.

breakdown.description: This portion will be refunded to your team upon check-in at the event.
This portion covers snacks and food to keep you fueled during the hackathon.

steps.title: Await Confirmation
steps.description: Once the registration period closes, our team will review all applications. You will receive an official confirmation email informing you if your team has been selected to participate.
